intro: Zigadenus hybridus, commonly known as the death camas, is a toxic plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Due to its toxicity, it should be handled with care and is often avoided in landscaping.
